movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: An Apt title; makes the original look like a masterpiece
review_detailed_main: In the original Dumb and Dumber review, I said that it was a "reason to see comedies". For me, the original had a special place in my childhood, I've seen in many times since, and I still consider it to be the Farrelly Brothers' best work to date. Now here is a prequel (the execs probably thought, hey Lucas can do it, how hard can it be) and I think that, if anything else, it is an extremely pale retread/imitation of the original material. I'm not saying the movie is entirely laughless, in fact there were a few moments when I had a chuckle or two or some grins at the reckless ingenuity of the characters' stupidity (there's even one laugh out loud moment inside the "Special-Needs" classroom involving a quiet jock when he gets riled up by the other students). The problem lies in that any of the "original" jokes or gags have been done in so many other movies it can only be amusing after a while to the most slight of minds...which means that it will at least earn back a little of the money it took to make it. In other words, Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd is precisely for it's target group, and it doesn't aim for anything more or audacious like the original, and there's only a minor curiosity to see these two knuckleheads portray younger versions of Carrey and Lloyd. I didn't hate it, but when I left I wanted at least half of a refund. D+

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: I saw dumb and dumber years ago in the cinema and thought it was 'the best thing since sliced bread' and when I heard they were making another one I was so happy and wondered how this could top the origional and when I saw it I realised as anyone who are put through it will that they didnt try to top the original they tried to destroy it. I feel sorry for the cast of this who will have one hell of a fight saving their careers. I mean the carachters were so dumb and the ending prodictable.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Harry and Lloyd weren't as funny back in high school
review_detailed_main:
The Farrelly brothers' first movie, "Dumb & Dumber", turned out to be a hit, and has been enjoyed by many people with a sick sense of humour over the years, including me. This prequel, on the other hand, released nine years later, which the Farrelly brothers did not write or direct, turned out to be a flop. While it seems that "Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd" is generally considered terrible, I don't think it is, but it's certainly no match for its predecessor.

Harry Dunne is born in 1969, and as he grows up, he is home-schooled by his mother until one year in high school, in the 1980s. This is when his mother finally sends him to regular school. After this happens, he soon meets one of his peers, Lloyd Christmas, and they soon become two very dimwitted friends. Ms. Heller, the school lunch lady, gets Harry and Lloyd to gather some students for a "special needs" class, which they will also be in. However, the two pals have no clue that this is all a scam hatched by Ms. Heller and Principal Collins to cheat the school out of enough money to buy a condo in Waikiki! Jessica, a girl that Harry and Lloyd know, however, is suspicious!

You might think I'm crazy for saying this, but watching "Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd" wasn't a completely laugh-free experience for me. I didn't laugh very much, but did at times, such as when Harry is at Jessica's house and gets chocolate all over the bathroom, causing her dad to throw a fit when he sees it, thinking it's feces (yes, that is very immature, it still made me laugh, I can't deny that)! There were also times when I just smiled. However, for the most part, I didn't think it was funny. The last time I watched "Dumb & Dumber", I think I had a smile on my face as I started watching, knowing what I was in for, but that wasn't the case with this sequel. Also, the two famous main characters are just not the same.

When a movie is as poorly received as this one turned out to be, I usually understand. I wouldn't say I like "Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd" too much, my 5/10 rating makes that clear, but the fact that it has gotten more 1/10 votes than any others still makes me feel that I mustn't have seen the same movie. I might even be able to give this movie a 6/10. I guess I'm in the minority of viewers who weren't absolutely disgusted by this 2003 flop, but I still don't think it's really that good overall. I wouldn't say it should be avoided like the plague, but since many others would, you might want to do so, I just don't know.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: This is my first review. I love this movie!
review_detailed_main:
This is my 1st time writing a review after being a huge fan of IMBD for years! 99% of the time, I dont start a movie without checking the rating here. I was highly upset to see this movie with such low ratings. This is one of my favorite comedies. It's one of those movies you have to watch twice to see its full potential. I've seen this more than I've seen the original and Jim Carry is one of my all time favorite actors. They chose the perfect cast. Its was awesome watching the making of this movie. They decided to keep everyone who tried out for the main casting and did their best to give them a part.

Dont watch with high expectations and you wont be disappointed.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Not an Oscar Winner-but what the Hell did you expect?
review_detailed_main:
I give this film a very respectable 6. It would've gotten a 7 if it wasn't for my cousin constantly reminding me that it wasn't as funny as the original at every chance.

Were this film not a 'prequel' but released before the original it may have been given half a chance. But if your the kind of person who thinks that different actors ruin a movie then you wont like it. If your a 'silly-film-lover' like myself or even just a general film lover then I advise you to give it a chance!

Granted - Carrey and Daniels are classics-Carrey is one of my all time faves! But surely without the writers, a film is nothing? Well it's the same writers so that must mean something

-and I think Richardson and Olsen were brave to step in to such legendary shoes - but you'll never please everybody, I s'pose.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
Dumb & Dumberer is a classic example of a movie idea that will turn out 'bad,' no matter how 'good' you make it. I think the writers of this one did the best they possibly could with the idea... but it was doomed to fail from the start. The original Dumb & Dumber was a risky movie to film; there were so many areas in which the movie could fail, and the sequel manages to fail in all of them.

Still, you may want to check this out if you want a quick laugh. Pretty much everything in here is a hit or miss, and while nearly everything is a miss, there are a few memorable moments that will manage to get a chuckle out of you. But if you want a true comedy classic, go rent the original.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Thanks Hollywood... you've managed to swindle my money once again.
review_detailed_main:
I see there are a few people that actually liked (no, LOVED) this movie... I am going to keep tabs on them and make sure I stay away from anything they recommend... ever.

I cant say that this production was the absolute worst thing Ive seen, because that would have to mean it fails on all cylinders. I didnt laugh at all, but I did stick around to watch the superb performance by Eric Olsen. He nailed Jim Carrey's character of Lloyd Christmas perfectly, no one else could have even come close. Although it was a shame this role was ever resurrected.

What is so sad is that the production company knew it was god-awful, yet still pumped about $15 million into hype advertising, praying to break even.

Thanks Hollywood... youve managed to swindle my money once again.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Stupid, but not in the way Dumb & Dumber was stupid
review_detailed_main: I didn't have high expectations for this movie, which is the way you should go into this movie. I knew that it would be mediocre in comparison to the masterpiece that is Dumb & Dumber played by wonderful hilarious actors. Obviously, not everyone's going to like the fact that it's played by different people (including me.) It's enjoyable though there are some eye-roller moments. It's a fun movie that's easy to watch, especially if you're bored. If anyone expected a masterpiece, they probably came out of the theater wondering why they even bothered. But what do you expect from a sequel with different people playing the roles? It was just a bomb waiting to happen.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: The original hasn't aged well but was extremely in the time period. I can't imagine anyone from a newer generation laughing at any of the original either. It was funny for the dark shock humor but we've had shows like Jackass since then. The original was the perfect movie at the perfect time for that sort of comedy. That time is over. There was no way to recapture that again so this movie was doomed from the start of filming.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: Jim carry and jeff daniels are not in this and i am glad they weren't in it because this would have ruined there career 's which brings me to the original actor's aren't in it those two had personality these guys who replaced them are horrible the acting is terrible the directing is bland and boring this movie is also very ugly but the biggest flaw is the humor since this was the two thousands comedy's were just nothing but gross out humor and this is a prime example

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: One of the dumberest movie's I've seen in a while
review_detailed_main:
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd is a prequel to the Jim Carrey/Jeff Daniels comedy Dumb and Dumber, but it lacks all the heart of it. In Dumb and Dumber, the characters were so dumb that it was funny, but in this one not only the characters, but the actual movie is so dumb that it's just....dumb. It uses some of the same gags but it's overall style is what makes it so bad. It seems more like a gross-out teen comedy than a buddy comedy.

Even some hardcore fans of Dumb and Dumber will probably not like this. The plot is stupid, and there aren't enough funny parts to save it. I do give those two guys credit for doing such a good job in filling Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels' shoes, though. Their Harry and Lloyd impressions are almost perfect. Other than that, and maybe one or two funny parts, this movie blows.

My rating: 1/10

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Rachel Nichols is what made the movie worth watching
review_detailed_main: she made the movie worth watching...especially her in the two piece bikini. mmm mmm mmm. otherwise, the whole movie blew. and if anyone thought this movie was great, they have a poor sense of humor. this movie sucked along with the nutty professor 2. a giant BOO to both films

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Underrated comedy genius --- or mental dysfunction...
review_detailed_main: Now, mainstream critics and audiences alike are pathetic at this point in history. Accepting humor and just having a good time is hard with many, especially when some are trying to maintain a grand reputation. This is the case with the overall acceptance of this riotous film. A campy plot and set of jokes couldn't possibly lose a viewer's interest, could it? I mean, people laugh at Family Guy, a show with humor clearly as subjective and ridiculous as that of Dumb and Dumberer. Even Blue Collar humor is more clichéd than this. I admire the entire good mood of this film. I felt great after viewing it. I also haven't laughed that hard in an unnamed amount of time. Don't believe the criticism --- the only reason I can think of for those types of comments is that the lead roles aren't played by the same actors. Yet, who would want to see 40-somethings playing teenagers?

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: clear your mind first of your expectations
review_detailed_main:
Considering this is a prequel to one of the most popular cult classics of the 90s, something like this is going to get back-lashed.

First off, to all the critics, please stop calling this film a piece of crap. It may look like crap, but seriously people, I think Dumb And Dumberer is a great idea.

Didn't see this in the theater, but saw the trailer plenty of times to get me interested in the idea. The trailer alone was really funny, and reminded me that every once in a long while, there has to be a movie that has to be this ridiculous to laugh at. With that said, I honestly think that the sequel coming out later this year will hopefully resonate well with the fans.

Slap yourself a few times over, then sit down and see what you think of this movie when you put it in next, or when it shows up on TV.

The female lead will be at the Seattle Comic-Con this year, (2014) and will hopefully meet her.

It may not live up to the original, but they used plenty of original material to give you an idea of how dumb Harry and Lloyd really are.

(Loved the idea of Harry's invisible captain friend! Seeing the car hit that wooden wagon was pretty priceless!!)

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: I agree with most reviews that this movie was far from anything great. The script needed a re-write, possibly help from the Farrelly Brothers could have helped. This movie had nothing to do with the creators of Dumb and Dumber, Bobby and Peter Farrelly. Besides having their names in the credits, the movie had nothing to do with the funny filmmakers. If they did, the film could have been saved. Unlike the story, the acting in the film is very good. Eric Olsen and Derek Richardson do the impossible. They have to act stupid, funny, and also portray the characters of Harry and Lloyd. They do an amazing job portraying younger versions of Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey's characters from the original 1993 comedy. With a better script, the movie could have done much better.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
If you're about to watch a prequel of "Dumb and Dumber", well, you sure know what you're about to see: an idiot and a retarded doing and saying things typical of an idiot and a retarded. In some sequences you'll wet your pants, and in some others you won't. That's it.

Those ones which are looking for intelligent humor, please just keep your distance. Those who wanna have a funny time "When Harry meet Lloyd" ain't that bad. It's quite remarkable the work of the guys in the casting section, for they've found an actor that REALLY looks (and behaves) like Jim Carrrey with 20 years less.

*My rate: 5/10

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Coulda been done without the Dumb and Dumber name.
review_detailed_main: They could have done this movie without it being the prequel to dumb and dumber. Most of the jokes related to the original dumb and dumber aren't even funny. The movie does have it's moments though, like the scenes with Bob Saget. It didn't even bother me that these guys weren't Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey. One of the major gripes i had with this movie was when it explains the origins of Lloyd's chipped tooth. When they run into each other you can clearly see that their heads don't even come close to touching. I give this movie a 5 out of 10.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
I saw the trailers, noticed Eugene Levy and Cheri Oteri were cast, and was amazed at how close the two young actors looked like Carrey and Daniels from the original. I thought I was in for a treat.

Sadly, it was mostly painful to watch. Lowbrow humor amuses me - don't get me wrong, I loved the first film - but this one just couldn't pull it off the way the Farrelly brothers did it. Bob Saget shouting about poo was funny the first time, but hearing him continue to shout just got lame after 10 seconds or so. And when a similar scene came up near the end... well, just forget it.

A few amusing scenes...



sigh.... at least it was a slightly cheaper matinee...

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Bob Saget sumbed it all up
review_detailed_main: Bob Saget correctly summed up this movie in one word. See the movie, and you'll know what that word is. It had its moments, I admit, that I enjoyed and were funny. Some of the gags were just plain stupid. The whole thing lacked direction, as evident by the montage scene and the deleted scenes over the credits. To me it seemed the writer and director had a whole load of gags that they knew were good for laughs, but just couldn't find a believable way to connect them all. This film will find its audience, just like Adam Sandler and Tom Green have their audiences. Different people find humor in different things. I just didn't find the majority of the film to be funny, it was just stupid.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: How do I put it nicely... dismal
review_detailed_main:
Dumb and Dumber truly is a comedy classic. And getting it on DVD at Walmart a bunch of years ago is how I was introduced to this prequel, Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd, since it was a double feature. Now, as everybody knows, whereas the original continues to get immense praise to this day for the Farrelly Brothers' clever writing, and especially Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels' off-the-charts comic chemistry, this prequel, which, unlike the sequel that I already reviewed, involved none of those men, was panned by critics and audiences alike upon release, and is mostly forgotten (to the point that the sequel openly ignored it and showed that the Farrelly Brothers had their OWN ideas about Harry and Lloyd's past). Honestly, I myself have never been really fond of the prequel, to the point that I do not watch it as frequently as the original. And after watching it with a friend who came over just tonight, I understood why very few people like it; this movie only had me laughing sporadically.

Set in 1986, 7 years before the events of the original movie, after being homeschooled all his life, 17-year-old dim-bulb Harry Dunne (played by Derek Richardson) is encouraged by his mom (Mimi Rogers) to attend public school, where he meets Lloyd Christmas (Eric Christian Olsen), who's exactly his age, and just as stupid to boot. On their first day of school, the duo are promptly roped into a phony "special needs" class set up by Principal Collins (Eugene Levy) with the help of his personal lover and cohort, school lunch lady Ms. Heller (Cheri Oteri), in a scheme to embezzle enough of the school's money to fund their new Waikiki condo (having already stolen a lot of the school's money using several other methods). Fellow student and school newspaper journalist Jessica (Rachel Nichols) soon catches wind of this corruption, and turns to Harry and Lloyd for help in her efforts to prove Collins and Ms. Heller's guilt.

You see, given this is a prequel, you should definitely expect re-used jokes and lines. But here's the problem: this entire prequel is basically a mix of jokes geared mostly toward grade-school age boys and overabundant nods to the original. To name a few: the scene of Harry's melted chocolate incident in Jessica's bathroom is a nod to the famous scene of him brutally pinching a loaf in Mary's toilet after Lloyd pranked him with laxative, the scene of Harry and Lloyd drinking slushies, leading to Harry getting brain freeze, is a twist on Harry and Lloyd burning their mouths when trying hot peppers, and the sexy twin girls in the convertible that Harry and Lloyd meet at the very end are a nod to the bikini models on the bus. Oh, and one of them is actually Fraida Felcher. Are you kidding me? When Fraida was mentioned in the first movie, Harry had no idea that Lloyd already knew who she was, so it would make zero sense for them to have both met her at the same time. It may just be that since Harry's dumb, he forgot, but I don't know.

This movie also gets several other things wrong from the original; one particularly egregious oversight is that in this movie, Harry seems to be the dumber one, having an imaginary friend and been held back at least 3 times during homeschooling, whereas Lloyd is the dumb one, acting as his mentor and guide to everyday life. This clashes with the original, where at the very beginning, the only dumb thing Harry did was get some dogs dirty on the way to a show through a combo of reckless driving and feeding them messy food, while Lloyd did a much larger amount of dumb things, not to mention much later in the movie, Harry had to help Lloyd read a simple sentence. It kind of makes me question whether Robert Brener (whoever he is), who came up with the story idea this movie is based on and co-wrote the script with director Troy Miller, and has never written another movie before or since, actually watched the original. In fact, as a YouTuber pointed out, he's likely directly related to New Line Cinema executive Richard Brener, and was hired to crap out a story outline and script for that reason alone. Hollywood nepotism right there.

Then, we've got the music. Eban Schletter, one of the guys behind the music on SpongeBob SquarePants, scored this movie. And honestly, outside of the grand, sweeping cue when Harry and Lloyd meet, it doesn't do much beyond underscore the onscreen action. In regards to the songs, many of them fit, but I do have one complaint: why, during the opening, do we have Lloyd dancing to Vanilla Ice's "Ice Ice Baby" being played diegetically over the school PA? That song did not even exist until 1991; 5 years after this movie's events!!

Now, let me get into some of the things that I did like about this movie: there were definitely a few scenes that did crack me up. In particular, the montage of Harry and Lloyd recruiting students for the special needs class had some really funny parts. I also loved any scene with the disgruntled gas station guy. But the funniest scene in the movie was Jessica's dad's profanity-infused rant when he thought Harry had defecated all over his bathroom ("HE S**T EVERYWHERE!!!!!").

And one other thing: the cast. This prequel is rounded out by several terrific actors. Derek Richardson and Eric Christian Olsen were, in my opinion, perfectly cast as Harry and Lloyd. In terms of both their mannerisms and their appearances, they definitely feel like high school versions of Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey's portrayals. In addition, Eugene Levy is clearly doing his best as Collins. Cheri Oteri is fine as Ms. Heller. Rachel Nichols is good as Jessica. And even though he has only two scenes, Bob Saget (may he rest in peace) makes the most of his role as Jessica's dad. *sigh* I just wish the cast was given quality material to work with. No matter how well an actor plays their role, it'll always be constrained by how poorly written their character is, or how bad the script in general is, and this prequel is no exception. In particular, Shia LeBouf (who I remember as Stanley from Holes) was terribly underused in this movie, as special needs student Lewis, the school mascot, who Harry and Lloyd recruit after mistaking him for a centaur. That being said, his reaction when the tiny special needs bus jumps a hill ("HEEEEEELLLLP MEEEEEE!!!!!!") was priceless.

But everything considered, Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd really is nothing more than a lame prequel. People love to throw the term "cash-grab" around too much, but unfortunately, that's exactly what this movie is: a very brazen cash-grab, meant to profit off the original's success. In fact, it feels like New Line Cinema didn't understand its audience at all. Whereas the original Dumb and Dumber is a deliberately stupid comedy for smart people, this prequel is JUST stupid. Despite a great cast and a few good gags here and there, this prequel has nothing else to salvage. All the same, I find myself revisiting it (quite rarely) for those alone, mostly because it's tacked on my DVD with the original, which I've had for many years, and the few good laughs it has to offer hold my attention before I get bored. Even so, you may wanna stick with the original.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
Quite simply put, this is a terrible attempt at a movie. Troy Miller should go back to directing Mr. Show, and the people who starred in this film have probably ruined whatever careers they had.

There are painfully few laughs as this thing lurches along. I think the main reason it seems so unfunny is the fact that the original film was one of the funniest movies made in the last decade. I have never laughed as hard since the original came out in 1994. I think I was even on the floor of the theater laughing during the snowman scene.

Sadly, this sequel has nothing that will make you more than slightly chuckle. Please don't waste your $ on this one at the theater. If you must see it, wait until it comes out on cable next year.

1 of 5 stars

So sayeth the Hound.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: I probably only laughed twice the whole movie. I was so dissapointed in this movie. The previews make it look hillarious, but I guess we were wrong. The whole story line and everything was so corny I almost got up and left, but I payed $6.50, and I wasn't gonna waste my money. I feel like I did though. There were only a couple funny jokes but the rest of the movie was unoriginal. I can't believe this movie made it to the theaters. It was a complete waste of time and money and I strongly recomend not seeing it. It recieves 1 out of 10 stars, and thats being generous!

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: I think this is funny stuff!
review_detailed_main:
I had the feeling this movie was going to do bad with the critics, I was right and I didn't think it would do good at the box office because this movie didn't have very good marketing and again I was right. But I still had high hopes for this movie! Jim Carrey is my idol and I was a little mad that he wasn't coming back, but you gotta understand, this dude wants to explore different characters. Anywayz, I went into this movie with my brother and we laughed out loud. Yeah there were some not so funny scenes, but it was still hilarious! Especially Bob Sagat! Eric Christian Olsen play Lloyd Christmas very well, but Derek Richardson is alright. I didn't think Eugene Levy gave his best, but Cheri was very funny! And that Rachel Nichols lady is mighty fine! Anywayz, all in all, this movie made me laugh, I wasn't disappointed, and I'm going to buy it when it comes out on DVD! I do have a life, but I can't put a movie down that easily (like Dreamcatcher), but this movie I didn't feel sorry for! But, yes, this movie could've done better with the Farrelly Brothers! I hope they get the thought to making a sequel and bring back Jim, Jeff, and Sebass! Although Dumb and Dumberer is funny stuff my man! 4 stars out of 4 stars

Sincerely Sidekick Jolly!

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
It really was not as funny as I thought it would be. It definitely would have been better if it had the original cast of Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels. The original Dumb and Dumber was made almost ten tears ago, (1994). Wow! Time flies! I remember seeing the original at Mission Drive in San Antonio. Oops enough nostalgia.

The positive of this movie is that the make up was great. Harry and Loyd looked exactly like Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels. I saw the actors in an interview without the makeup, and they are completely different looking. It was quite a transformation. Unfortunately this movie was just plain boring and not very humorous. One of the few funny scenes is when Harry pulls out a melted Hershey bar from his pants, and tries to get the chocolate off by rubbing it on the walls of the bathroom. Jessica's dad played by Bob Saget cannot believe that he rubbed excrement all over his walls, and starts freaking out. 6/10

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
Catching the first teaser that came out on cinemas I was very excited about this movie since I thought it would be a Jim Carrey movie. Later I realised it was not and was kind of disappointed.. still, I had my hopes up when watching a sneak preview.

But gosh was I wrong, altho the actors do a decent job in portraying the young Harry & Lloyd, it's just simply not as funny. Instead it rolls out into an average 'stupid-comedy' a la a bad sequel of Police Academy.

The jokes are too few and when they do pop up they're not allt that funny. Too much time is spent on the characters actually getting into character.

Naw, just a bad sequel living on the hype of it's prequel. One of many. Stay away from this one, and if you have to catch it, I'd wait and get it on VHS/DVD.

3/10

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Good lead actors, bad writing and directing
review_detailed_main: The story was lame, not just dumb. The scatalogical jokes were constipated. The scenes between the principal and his lover were pathetic. The best part of the movie was the imitations the new actors did of Jim Carey and Jeff Daniels. Too bad they will never get a chance to do it over. The writing was simply putrid.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: As bad and badder: Somebody owes me money
review_detailed_main: I believe that somebody owes me $12 (one ticket for my girlfriend and I) for that horrible movie. I have never gone into a movie with lower expectations...and I was still disappointed. This is the worse movie I have ever seen. However, I will give props to the guy who played Lloyd Christmas. He did a great impression. That's the best I got.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: It almost put me to sleep
review_detailed_main: Out of the hour and twenty minutes or so, I laughed about approximately thirty minutes. Sure Harry and Llyod were all right, but Eugene Levy was wasted and not a single thing he said was ever funny, Cheri Oteri was boring and both of them together were on the screen too much to be enjoyed. Bob Saget made a return to the big screen but overplayed his part and was a little bit exaggerated. Not enough to save the movie to be a disaster except the same jokes used in a different manner. Half the movie jokes were based upon the original's and it just wasn't good enough.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: I had the unfortunate opportunity to see a sneak preview of Dumb and Dumberer last night. This movie (not film) did not have ONE redeeming quality. People were leaving the theater a half hour into the film. I however was not as smart as said people and left with about a half hour left. DO NOT see this movie. It is not even "dumb funny", it is just boring and was a big mistake from the beginning. Trust me, this movie is a waste of two hours.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Stupidest Film Of The Year Award?
review_detailed_main: That was one stupid film! Everything I expected though, a poor sequel, or rather prequel. :) It had some funny parts however which made me laugh. It was nice and short, but nothing like the original. Not worth spending money in the theater though, maybe a video rental? 5/10

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Inept and Cringeworthy attempt at Comedy
review_detailed_main:
This was a trainwreck that everyone should have seen coming. A sequel to a comedy classic that had a new director, new writers, and new forgettable nobody actors playing the leads. Lloyd is played by Eric Christian Olsen, who is most remembered for his role in Not Another Teen Movie and as a regular on NCIS: Los Angeles. Olsen does a fine job imitating Jim Carrey's Lloyd Christmas from the original, but the writing doomed this movie. Derek Richardson plays Harry Dunne, Richardson is most remembered for his role in Eli Roth's film Hostel just a few years later.

The comedy in this film is extremely underwhelming, I didn't laugh once. Even the best jokes this movie has are only slightly amusing, you may crack a smile but nothing more. Eugene Levy and Bob Saget are the saving grace that keeps the movie out of 1 star territory for me. Both actors are trying their best and are easily the funniest parts of the movie.

It's truly incredible that the original film has aged as well as it has. All the jokes that landed in 1994 still land three decades later. The same cannot be said about the follow up, which has aged like a raisin in the Nevada sun. Whether it be having the Asian foreign exchange student referred to as Ching Chong. Or the many jokes about special needs students, or a gay slur being used repeatedly by the protagonists. These cringeworthy missteps just shows the difference that quality script writing and directing can make.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: As a huge fan of the origional Dumb and Dumber I saw this movie, even though everyone I talked to said it was horrible. This movie should have went strait to video. I left the theater half way through the movie because it was so bad. The actors did a good job with what they had, but the script is just terrible. If you want to see this, definately wait for it to come out on VHS or DVD and watch it. I'm glad the Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey did not get involved in this because they are both much better actors than what this script could even dream to offer.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
When I saw the first trailer for this movie I thought to myself, "No way, if Jim Carrey ain't in it, what's the point? It's just some crappy movie the studios are trying to get money for. It'll suck." And I'm sure most people will tell me I was right. And okay, it was some crappy movie the studios were trying to cash in on BUT, it most definitely did NOT suck. In fact, it rocked!

If you want to see this movie because you loved the first one, you probably will hate it. You'll probably say it lost all the appealing features of the first one and just kept the dirty "potty humour". And I won't argue with you. But, if like me, you can look at this film, not as a prequel to a great movie, but as just a movie, you should find it has a certain charm.

Eric Christian Olsen made a complete transformation for this movie (its hard to believe, but he's the "cocky blonde guy" from Not Another Teen Movie"). He did as good a job, if not better, than Jim Carrey could have done himself. It's a worthwhile movie, just to see ECO play this character so well.

And then there's Bob Saget. Everyone knows him as the dad in almost every cute kids TV show, so to hear him swear like that...well that's worth the price of rental at least!

Anyway, this movie isn't going to make you think, or do anything more than make you glad you have a better IQ that Harry and Lloyd, but it is one of those movies that is so funny and simple that I, at least, want to watch it over and over again. Give it a chance, keep an open mind, forget about the original. It might not be a good "prequel", but it is a great movie. In my humble opinion, at least. :-)

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Not the worst movie ever but not one third of the greatness of the first.
review_detailed_main: Dumb and Dumberer is a sequel to the Farrely Brother classic Dumb and Dumber and does not deserve the horrible rating it has got. The movie is about before the first movie or when Harry and Lloyd met each other in High School. The movie is a bit of a copy but brings a new look on the first one. The movie is good most of the time but like in the first movie they are pretty stupid in this movie they are the biggest pair of Retards ever and are beyond stupid. Overall this movie is good but nothing great. You should definitely watch this movie if you have nothing better to watch but should probably just watch Dumb and Dumber again and if you have not already seen Dumb and Dumber see it now. I rate this movie 62%. Also Eugene Levy is pretty good as the bad Principle.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: This movie caused vomiting, headaces, and then I left.
review_detailed_main: Trash is all I have to say. I mean I gave this movie the hope of it being funny but it was just horrable. One of the many problems is they make them too dumb. I mean in this one they think getting beat up is a type of showing ones love. Levy's charecter gave me hope that it would be a litle funny, wrong! movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Oh, no!! Another teen movie cleverly disguised as a sequel to a GOOD movie!

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: What? There was a second Dumb and Dumber?!
review_detailed_main:
Talk about disappointment. The whole time I was watching this movie my friend and I shook our heads in shame as the two main actors (playing Harry and Lloyd) tried to impersonate the infamous Carrey and Daniels' jokes from the first movie. It just isn't happening. From the "I LIKE IT ALOT" to the "It" game, the movie just flunked in the joke area and impersonations. It was full of potty humor, that mainly kids would enjoy. I will admit. I did laugh at a few parts in the movie. For example, best part - Bob Saget swearing at the top of his lungs. However, just as most of us thought, this movie was a pitiful attempt to try and recount the hilarious movie of 1994. No Farrelly Brothers, no Jim Carrey, no Jeff Daniels! You know it's going to be a flop. One of the best parts of the first movie was the quality songs that went along with the plot (i.e. "The Flower Girl", "Boom Shack-a-lak", "Oh Pretty Woman", etc.). This movie was void of a good soundtrack. Save your $8.25 and wait until this comes out on video. P.S. - Sorry to Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels - this movie is an embarassment to your brillance and laughter you created in the first movie. YOU SHOULDA BEEN IN THE SECOND ONE!

Rating: C- (2 out of 5 stars)

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: This movie was not funny. The only reason I give it a 3 is because the actors did a decent job portaying the originals. The only time I laughed was at Bob Saget. What does that say about a movie? Bob Saget is funny and all, but is he usually the most memorable piece in a flick? I feel soo bad for the actors, they did a great job.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: I want my two hours back...

But this one had a poor cast of no name actors, who arent overly funny, and writters who arent sure exactly what humor is. The plot: not so good, a few funny lines here and there... Dont waste the $9.00, wait for it on dvd, or just read the reviews :) - I wouldnt have seen it if I wasnt offered a screening oppurtunity... Hopfully I saved two hours of your life... Becuase I clearly lost mine, and may never get that back... You can owe me later...

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
WARNING TO THOSE WHO MAY NOT HAVE SEEN THIS YET: avoid this movie at all costs. Count to a million, start a used gum collection, bang your head against the wall until you pass out, do anything as long as it is not going to see this movie. Yes, it is that bad...

In twenty or thirty years, the people of my generation may look back at Troy Miller the way many others look back at Ed Wood, Jr... as the worst director to ever make a movie. Yes, it IS that B-A-D. Eugene Levy, Luis Guzman, what the heck were you two thinking? This movie is stupendous in its badness.... triumphing in its apparent goal to challenge "Plan 9 From Outer Space" for the title of the worst movie ever made.

There is nothing good to say about this movie, plain and simple. The plot is shotty at best, the acting is off the charts bad, and the dialogue is so incredibly bad that you start to think that the writers belonged in the "special class." This movie succeeds in damaging the legacy of its predecessor, which is an extremely funny movie that solidified Jim Carrey's status as the comic genius that he is, and that is a shame.

This movie should have never been made. The Farrelly brothers and Jim Carrey knew that it would not work, this should have been enough for New Line to not make this movie.

Just think about how bad a movie must truly be for it to be carried by Bob "Full House" Saget in a two scene role. Troy Miller, please stop making movies now.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
One of the worst movies I've seen in the last 12 months bar none. This movie actually made THE RING and SIGNS look GOOD. When I saw THE RING and SIGNS, I was laughing throughout the entire movies. When I saw DUMB AND DUMBERER, I did not laugh one time, except for the Freda Felcher part. That is pretty bad when I laugh at movies that are supposed to be scary and just sit there with no expression during a movie that's supposed to be a comedy.

There is a lot of good talent wasted on a TERRIBLE script. The guys that played Harry and Lloyd had the characters to a T! Good performances by Mimi Rogers, Eugene Levy, Cheri Oteri and others.

Save your money.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: It's not that bad but it's not good. It's this movie that you watch, you didn't feel anything at all, no happy,no laugh, just nothing. It was going in straight line and finished.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: No one in the cinema laughed throughout the entire film.
review_detailed_main:
The funniest thing that happened was that someone pretended to fart loudly when the lights went out. Once the film started there was silence as all the attempts to be funny just failed.

The audience ranged from adults to 12 year olds. And once the 12 year olds started saying things like "Oh, wasn't that funny?" out loudly you knew the film was bad for all age ranges. People walked out constantly and as soon as the credits started rolling there was a sarcastic burst of applause and everyone left, ignoring the outtakes.

This is possibly the worst film I have ever seen in my life. And I've sat through some bad films.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: I don't know what it is about this movie but but I love it so much. There is some dumb parts for sure but they are still funny as heck.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
What on earth was I thinking when I willingly purchased a ticket for this abysmal attempt at a prequel? I know that prequels/sequels generally never live up to the expectations of the original, but I feel I must applaud Troy Miller on setting a new benchmark that sequels must stay well clear of.

The movie starts off by showing us a little bit of Harry's (Derek Richardson) childhood and a 'hilarious' experience with his imaginary friend. And take it from me folks, it gets worse. What follows is 90 minutes of pure cinematic dung. From the distasteful (a scene in which Harry appears to smear faeces on a bathroom wall) to the downright confusing (a not so funny `your it' sequence in a convenience store).

My view after watching the 1994 original was that Lloyd and Harry were just two buddies that were caught up a world that was just moving too fast for them. However, in this movie, Miller puts them across as being mentally disabled and so incompetent that they may not even develop into the people they are in the 1994.

The film takes every single hilarious scene from the original and milks it relentlessly, so much so that you may find yourself cringing when a line from the first is said. Don't get me wrong, I LOVED the original, it is one of my favourite comedies but this shoddy knock-off has the ability to discourage a person from watching the original.

The cast list looks attractive on paper. Eugene Levy, Luis Guzman, Mimi Rogers and Cheri Oteri have all starred in fine comedies over the past few years but this movie is one I think that would be better left off the résumé. Eric-Christian Olsen on the other hand may be one of the lucky ones, and this may actually benefit his career. His perfect take-off of Jim Carrey is flawless in both mannerisms and accent. He even managed to get a chuckle out of me in a scene involving him using a floor buffer on a sidewalk.

All in all, this movie is a complete waste of time and money for the cinema patron. If you want a laugh, rent the original. Its jokes are still as funny as they were in 1994, however, I can't see us looking back in 2012 in reminisce this movie.

1 out of 10

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: This was one of the most disappointing movies I have seen in a long time. Dumb and Dumber was such a classic movie that I expected nothing less from this one. However, I knew it wouldn't be up to par because it wasn't directed by the Farrelly brothers and the two previous stars Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels weren't in it. Also, the movie used the same jokes as in the first one only they weren't as funny the second time (especially since I've seen the first one about a hundred times). All in all, this movie was nowhere near as funny as the original and I was thoroughly disappointed.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
Oh man, all this talk about sequels never being able to live up to the first movie really rings as true as ever in this case.

This film is nothing but a pure rip-off, disappointment of the year, a complete waste of time, and even if you loved the first Dumb&Dumber movie, you'll even hate the original after watching this sequel (or rather, prequel).

I have to say though, that the actor - unknown as he is and probably will remain - who plays the Lloyd character does a pretty good Jim Carrey-copy - but then again, what's the point when the film is as bad as this. No fun, just poop jokes - and although Harry's toilet visit in the original film was hilarious, thier attempt to copy it is disasterous..

No madder if you like the first film or not; do not waste your time with this garbage, that's just free advice!!!

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
Do not, under any circumstances, give your money to the clods that filmed this attrocity.

This is one of the worst movies I've ever seen. There is nothing redeeming. The plot is horrible and the movie consists of nothing but predictable gags between ripoffs of the first movie - from the fire at the gas station to the bathroom scene - it's all been ripped off and performed so horribly that it will detract from the wonderful experience you had watching the original.

Please, do yourself a favor, go watch the original again and don't EVER watch this. You will regret it.

Now, I never considered myself an intellectual (at all), and I do like this type of film (I loved the first one anyway), but this sequel (or prequel, whatever), is really a piece of rubbish. I've seen lots crap movies lately, but this one really beats them all. Ignore some of the other user comments, this movie is NOT 'funny as hell'! Avoid it at all cost!

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: why people don't like this movie
review_detailed_main: i think the reason people don't like this movie is that first, they expected or wanted to see jim and jeff reprising their roles. second, they viewed it and compared it to the dumb and dumber original. i went into the movie with no expectations and i found it to be hilarious. i think as long as you don't think of the original, which probably is hard to do, then you'll enjoy this movie. in its own way, its goofy, fun, and enjoyable. me and my friends use a lot of the quotes from this movie and the first and we just laugh our a**es off.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: The original Dumb and Dumber, to me, was a classic. A film that will forever remain in my private collection of DVDs. It wasn't only the subtle humor in the first film, but also the scenic locations they used. From RI to Aspen, we were along for the trip, amused with each scene building upon the last. But, what humor can be found from this film? What story-line are we exposed to? The answer is none. I was particularly impressed with the portrayal of Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels that these two new actors gave, but this was the only impressive part of the film. I know I cannot expect a "high-class" comedy with a film like this, but none of the jokes worked in this film. None of the blatant puns or overused "one-liners" even remotely gave the impact of the first film. Although, I will concede that the scene with Bob Saget and the Hersey's Bar was enough to crack a smile, but this still does not justify spending 8 bucks. This felt more like watching a film written by and staring Rob Schneider. Dirp. 1/10

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
I went into this movie *expecting* the worst. That's right. I knew it was going to be terrible and I saw it anyway. I had this whole plan of how I was going to ruin it for everyone by laughing way too hard at jokes that were really unfunny, just to make everyone turn and look at me and think "what's wrong with you", and repeat back lines that weren't witty at all, adding "that's so funny" and etc. Well, my little game got boring fast. After about 5 minutes, no one was responding at all to my little outbursts, so I just stopped and watched the movie. After twenty minutes of the movie, I was so annoyed and bored with the movie that I walked out.

This movie is the first movie I have ever walked out of. I'm quite the masochistic movie-watcher. I'll watch anything. This movie couldn't even maintain *my* interest. I laughed at the one scene where Lloyd wrote a message for his father in gigantic ketchup letters, but it wasn't a sustained laugh, and it was the only real one.

1/10, definitely. I've probably seen worse movies, but none come to mind right now.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: If you ignore the main characters it's ok.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: What does this series and Star Wars have in common? Prequels are not its forte.
review_detailed_main: It's just kinda uninteresting. Yeah, we get an introduction to the character, and all these other characters as well, but it really doesn't have much of an impact since we know we're never gonna see them again.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: A Fitting Name For A Movie
review_detailed_main: Never, in the history of cinematography, has a movie had such a fitting title. No, I'm not referring to the intelligence of the two "stars" of the movie, but instead of the movie itself. Dumb and Dumberer was simply that. It started off dumb, and just got plain dumberer. Never in my entire life have I been so bored and unentertained that in those 82 minutes. The movie is pointless! A crooked high school principal tries starting up a phony special needs class so he can receive a $100,000 grant from the school board, so he and his girlfriend (the school lunchlady) can run off together to Waikiki. I really do feel bad though for Eric Christian Olsen and Derek Richardson who looked and acted EXACTLY like their famous counterparts, but were shorted with a cheap script, no jokes, and even worse, predictablity and THE SAME LINES from the original movie. I gave this movie a 1 out of 10 on the imdb scale, which is GENEROUS considering there are no 0's on there. This was by far the worst sequel and arguably the worst movie of all time. America and the World, if you see this movie, you can't be any dumberer.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Plotless movies lead to very short summaries, much like this one...
review_detailed_main:
I didn't like the first movie, but I went to see this one with a friend because she really, REALLY wanted to go.

This movie is 82 minutes long. When I left the theater, however, I felt like I had been there for hours and hours. I laughed a few times, but mostly the movie was incredibly uncomfortable and embarrassing to watch. The jokes were shallow, predictable, and weren't even funny. Not even Eugene Levy or Shia LaBeouf were laugh-worthy. Sadly enough, only Bob Saget should get any credit for laughs here. However, "Harry" and "Lloyd" actually captured their older counterparts quite well.

Another major problem I had with this movie was the anachronisms. No matter how stupid or amateurish the movie may be, if it's supposed to be 1986, at least put in some other than dressing everyone up like it's a bad 80s dance party.

In short, don't even bother seeing this movie unless you really enjoyed the first one, or you're too young to drive yourself there and you plan to entertain yourself by farting the entire night and kicking the back of everyone's seat in front of you, because that's what the 3 incredibly immature kids behind me did, which made the movie even worse.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
I saw a special screening last night. WOW! What a let down. I usually like those kinds of movies (Dumb and Dumber, Tommy Boy, etc.), but his one was awful. Not that there should be a great plot in these types of movies, but this one went nowhere.

It seemed that the producers just put this out to make a buck. This movie really had a lot of potential, but just didn't utilize it; like it was just thrown together over the weekend. There were only two scenes that were funny, the rest was just infantile filler to make it 90 minutes long. You could definitely tell that the Farrelly Brothers had nothing to do with it.

In short, worse than Weekend at Bernie's II (1993).

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd is a buddy comedy film directed by Troy Miller. The film stars Derek Richardson and Eric Christian Olsen

It is the second installment in the Dumb and Dumber franchise and a prequel to the 1994 film Dumb and Dumber.

Harry Dunne and Lloyd Christmas meet in high school and become best friends. They decide to help Principal Collins set up a special needs class, but rise in revolt on discovering his true intentions.

The film certainly has some really funny and hilarious comedy scenes but the major drawback of the film is probably the lead characters were desperately trying to copy Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels hence never came up with something of their own.

The screenplay of the film is decent and the film surely has some honest funny moments. The acting in the film is probably the biggest disappointment with most of the supporting characters either underused or wasted.

Overall a decent but a wasted effort.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: This movie is not as awful as everyone says it is. This was a great movie. It is a stupid movie, but it is supposed to be,hence the name dumb and dumber. Everyone says that it would have been better with Jim Carey and Jeff Daniel's, but I disagree. The two actors who played their role were amazing to me. The plot was stupid, but i thought it was funny anyway. I don't care how many stars this movie has or how much money it made in the box-office. This was one of the funniest movies have ever seen and one of the best. It is not the dumb movie everyone says it is. I loved this movie and i recommend it to anyone who loves comedy. This movie is awesome!

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: It's Pretty Funny and 10x Funnier than the Newest Sequal

It's light, it's funny, and the actors reaaaallly put themselves out there. It's not amazing, it's not the best thing at all but it is entertaining. I think people like to hate because parts of it are cringe and weird which is what they were aiming for. The plot is dumb, the characters are charicatures, it's lots of physical humor. It's funny because this was Even Steven's Era and Shia LeBouf was the straight mammon this. I remember it throwing me off he was a goofball, just a nerd. It's how Harry and Floyd met, whay did you expect?

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Should Have Never Been Thought Of

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: First, I absolutely cannot stand prequels. Hate 'em with a passion. But I rented this one because I liked the first movie so much, and I actually liked this one just as much. Those guys really put in a serious effort to be enough like the original Harry & Lloyd (Carrey and Bridges), but not so much like them that it went over like a movie full of impressions. Face it: we don't watch a movie called "Dumb and Dumber(er)" for the intellectual conversation; it's silly, stupid comedy and it works very well. Don't knock these guys or this movie until you've seen it, then make a decision.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: One of the funniest movies ever made!
review_detailed_main: Besides Kung Pow:Enter The Fist Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd has to be one of the funniest movies ever made.From the beginning all the way to the end credits the film has nothing but gross outrageous humor and Eric Olsen plays the part better than Jim Carrey.For those who liked this one but still have yet to see the original don't cause it sucks.Dumb and Dumberer made up for the waste of the original.It's funny and actually has a point.If you like movies like Kung Pow and Jackass:The Movie(which I happen to love both of them)then this is the film for you.Some people can't appreciate funny movies but I am not one of those people.This movie is a must see and beats those crappy flicks like The Mask and the original Dumb and Dumber just to name a few.I recommend buying it!

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: I thought this movie was great. Although the second half was lagging a bit and I found myself missing Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels. It's not a horrible film but you will find yourself wondering why you're still laughing. And remember that Wednesday is Southwest day in the cafeteria.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Doesn't capture the same effect as the first

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
Just as hilarious as the original Dumb & Dumber. This movie sticks to comedy, not drama. It gets to the point, moves along well. A well-thought out movie that is not stupid. I give it a 10 out of 10 because I thoroughly enjoyed it. Good acting, good characters, good performances, good story. The movie is actually quite sincere. It's not pretentious.

Why the low ratings and bad reviews by others? I came to this movie with no expectations or preconceived notions about anything or anyone. If they made this movie any better it would simply have been different, not better. Highly recommended. I also recommend "The 'Burbs" (1989) starring Tom Hanks.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: This movie should be used in torture camps

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: In the words of Bill and Ted this is film is EXCELLENT!! (riff)
review_detailed_main: God's honest truth this film is very very good, its written by the Farey Brothers the guys who wrote the original Dumb and Dumber, and you can tell, ok its not Jeff Daniels and Jim Carrey but it is a close as you could possible get. This film has been slagged off by every film critic, but when have has a film critic ever been right? The film starts off with the meeting off Harry and Lloyd, and their relationship develops, they have to put together a "Special" class, this "Special" class allows the school to get a $100,000 grant which the head master plans to run off with, with the help of jessica, Harry and Lloyd foil his plot infront of the whole school. A very funny film in the TRUE sense of dumb and dumder.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Why Does Everyone Hate This So Much?
review_detailed_main:
Before the events in Dumb & Dumber, before they move on, before they grow up (very slowly)...there was high school.

Basically it's Eric Christian Olsen taking over for Jim Carrey and Derek Richardson taking over for Jeff Daniels. It wasn't as long as Dumb & Dumber, but that can be overlooked, especially knowing that comedy movies are all spanned around 75-90 minutes with about 30 exceptions every year.

I can't understand why everyone hates this so much. Is it because Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels weren't in it? If that's so, then let me ask you this. Since they've aged 9 years since Dumb & Dumber, do you really think they'd be perfect teenagers? Jim Carrey reached his 40th birthday in 2002! Overall, Dumb & Dumberer was 85 minutes of pure fun.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
Compared to the first movie this movie is NOT a disappointing sequel, (err, rather, prequel?). The casting was right on target, nobody else could have pulled off Harry and Lloyd as teenagers and done it such a brilliant manner.

Everything about Dumb and Dumberer fits right along with the second movie, which seems to be a major feat in Hollywood. Never once was I left thinking "Oh Harry (or Lloyd) would never have said or done THAT!".

Not quite as humorous as first movie, but still pretty darn hilarious and wacky.

If you liked Dumb and Dumber, you'll definitely love this movie.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
I actually liked this better than the original! I expected it to be awful, but found myself laughing hysterically throughout most of it once it got going. The whole cast was great, especially Mimi Rogers as Harry's mom, though the subplot with Lloyd falling in love with her never went anywhere, and Mimi herself disappears from the film early on, never to return.

Don't believe all the bad reviews; Dumb And Dumberer is a fun film that delivers exactly what it promises: plenty of crude toilet humor and slapstick silliness!

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: i knew this movie was going to be good, but i wasn't expecting this!

i did not think this movie was going to be as good as it was! this movie was hilarious! and to think "good morning america" rated this movie an F. an F?!?! i don't know WHAT they were on that day, but they said the acting sucked, the plot sucked, and there were no laughs. i think they sucked. if you are a big dumb and dumber fan, rush out and see this movie! it kicks ass! 9/10

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd

If you watch dumb and Dumberer first then watch dumb and dumber it would look like to some one who has not seen them in the correct order that Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels are mimicking Olsen and Richardson. These two pulled the characters off great. The silly antics that these two go through are hilarious and I wouldn't suspect anything less from them. They are the perfect people for stupidity. movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: This is by far one of the funniest movies I have ever seen in my entire life. It is so funny and there are little parts that if you pay attention you will laugh so hard. Especially look at the body language. That is one of the funniest parts of this movie. I recommend it.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: This is my all time favorite movie! I can't see how it can be in the bottom one-hundred. I guess you have to have a little thing called sarcasm to understand and enjoy it. Dumb and Dumberer is funny on so many levels. Not only can it make a sad person laugh, but it has sarcasm and wit as well as potty humour. I pity people who do not like this movie. If you have not seen this movie you MUST go see it as soon as you can. Call the local BlockBuster or whatever you go to rent your movies and ask them if they have it in stock. You must rent it. Dumb and Dumberer is one piece of work I must say. If you don't like it you have NO sense of humour.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main: I think that people that hated this movie should reconsider and actually watch the movie. people think that all because it is a remake, its going to be awful and tell the whole world that. this movie was a great movie and showed what happened to harry and lloyd in highschool and how they met. this movie was very funny, and cute. im not just saying this because i am a huge fan of eric christian olsen, im saying this to prove that this movie is an excellent movie and not to listen to what other people have to say about it and watch the movie for yourself to see what a cute and hillarious movie it really is.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
This movie was pretty much an okay flick. It was funny at some parts, although I think I liked Dumb and Dumber better (The first one) When I heard it was coming out, I was really excited because the first one was awesome. When I went to go see it in theaters with my friend, we found it to be really funny.

The only bad thing about it is it doesn't have Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels. The first one was hilarious, I found it to be really silly. But this one doesn't meet up to it, but it's still a good movie.

I would put it on a must watch list, you might really enjoy it.

8 stars out of 10

Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: Stupid, Funny, and Better than most recent comedies.
review_detailed_main:
I saw the trailer for this, and was quite excited. A few of my friends were not interested in seeing the film, as they stupidly believed that it is not possible to make a good second installment to a film without any of the original cast or crew. So i dragged my brother to see it. Within moments we were in tears of laughter.

From the word go the film hits you with some of the silliest jokes you could imagine, and they work. From Lloyd thinking Harry's mum is the tooth fairy, to discovering that Lloyd's dad is in fact a latino school janitor (wonderfully played by the very charismatic Luis Guzman). Granted, most of the characters in the film are quite dumb, but that is what makes the film work. If, like in the 1st film, everyone except Harry and Lloyd were smart, the comedy would not work. You begin to understand why Harry and Lloyd are so incrediblly stupid. I also believe that if everything was the same as the 1st film, then people would just be saying "it is the same movie, nothing new".

Troy Miller has definately proved that he can make a good comedy. He is on par with the Zuker brothers and Jim Abrahams. I would love to see a Troy Miller movie starring Will Farrell, Chris Kattan, and Leslie Neilson. With cameos by Adam Sandler, Ben Stiller, Owen Wilson and Rbin Williams. Obviously, by looking at my choice of comedians, you will begin to understand my sense of humour. So if you do not find these guys funny, then i recommend you give this film a miss. Stick to the more 'straight comedies' such as Legally Blonde (ZZZZZZZ!!).

Derek Richardson has manged to mimic Jeff Daniels perfectly. It is very believeable to think he is a younger Daniels. Eric Christian Olsen brings something of his own to Lloyd. The voice is similar, but Olsen has obviously realised that mimicing Carrey will get him slated by critics and audiences, so Lloyd belongs to Olsen in this film.

I loved this film. On DVD release, it will definately find it's way into my collection.

I give it 4 out of 5.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_detailed_main:
Most would watch this movie, expecting humor to jump right out and captivate them... however, this is the type of movie you have to watch expecting lame humor. If you're a fan of the "Scary Movie" trio filled with lame humor, or better yet, Old School, Anchorman (the original or the 2nd version), or any movies of the sort, then Dumb & Dumberer is for you.

I, personally, enjoyed this movie... my favorite part being the beginning (the dancing scene is probably one of the best ever, aside from Napoleon Dynamite's dancing attempt and the dance scene from 2005's "Hitch").

8/10 on this movie, most definitely.

movie_name: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
review_title: An apt title; makes the original look like a masterpiece.
review_detailed_main: In the original Dumb and Dumber review, I said that it was a "reason to see comedies". For me, the original had a special place in my childhood, I've seen in many times since, and I still consider it to be the Farrelly Brothers' best work to date. Now here is a prequel (the execs probably thought, hey Lucas can do it, how hard can it be) and I think that, if anything else, it is an extremely pale reread/imitation of the original material. I'm not saying the movie is entirely laughless, in fact there were a few moments when I had a chuckle or two or some grins at the reckless ingenuity of the characters' stupidity (there's even one laugh out loud moment inside the "Special-Needs" classroom involving a quiet jock when he gets riled up by the other students). The problem lies in that any of the "original" jokes or gags have been done in so many other movies it can only be amusing after a while to the most slight of minds...which means that it will at least earn back a little of the money it took to make it. In other words, Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd is precisely for it's target group, and it doesn't aim for anything more or audacious like the original, and there's only a minor curiosity to see these two knuckleheads portray younger versions of Carrey and Lloyd. I didn't hate it, but when I left I wanted at least half of a refund. c-.
